articles.headline: How a Canadian Chain Is Reinventing Book Selling
articles.snippet: Indigo is expanding to the United States with its new model for how a big bookstore chain can thrive in the era of online retail.
articles.abstract: Indigo is expanding to the United States with its new model for how a big bookstore chain can thrive in the era of online retail.
articles.lead_paragraph: About a decade ago, Heather Reisman, the chief executive of Canada’s largest bookstore chain, was having tea with the novelist Margaret Atwood when Ms. Atwood inadvertently gave her an idea for a new product.

articles.headline: Barr Defends Handling of Mueller Report Against Withering Rebukes
articles.snippet: Attorney General William P. Barr faced blistering criticism from Democrats about his characterizations of the Mueller report, but told the Senate Judiciary Committee he had been truthful.
articles.abstract: Attorney General William P. Barr faced blistering criticism from Democrats about his characterizations of the Mueller report, but told the Senate Judiciary Committee he had been truthful.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Attorney General William P. Barr defended himself on Wednesday against withering criticism of his handling of the special counsel investigation as Democrats accused him of deceiving Congress and acting as a personal agent for President Trump rather than a steward of justice.

articles.headline: Biden Faces Conflict of Interest Questions That Are Being Promoted by Trump and Allies
articles.snippet: As vice president, Joe Biden played a key role in the dismissal of a Ukrainian prosecutor who had opened an investigation of a company employing Mr. Biden’s son.
articles.abstract: As vice president, Joe Biden played a key role in the dismissal of a Ukrainian prosecutor who had opened an investigation of a company employing Mr. Biden’s son.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — It was a foreign policy role Joseph R. Biden Jr. enthusiastically embraced during his vice presidency: browbeating Ukraine’s notoriously corrupt government to clean up its act. And one of his most memorable performances came on a trip to Kiev in December 2015, when he threatened to withhold $1 billion in United States loan guarantees if Ukraine’s leaders did not dismiss the country’s top prosecutor, who had been accused of turning a blind eye to corruption in his own office and among the political elite.
articles.byline: By Kenneth P. Vogel and Iuliia Mendel

articles.headline: With Maduro Still in Power, Questions About the U.S. Role in Venezuela
articles.snippet: While the Trump administration got off to a sure-footed start, rallying dozens of countries against the Venezuelan leader, critics say its response had become haphazard and chaotic as the crisis has dragged on.
articles.abstract: While the Trump administration got off to a sure-footed start, rallying dozens of countries against the Venezuelan leader, critics say its response had become haphazard and chaotic as the crisis has dragged on.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Nobody said regime change was going to be easy.
articles.byline: By Mark Landler and Julian E. Barnes

articles.headline: Facebook Set to Create Privacy Positions as Part of F.T.C. Settlement
articles.snippet: Talks include creating a new committee and an external assessor that would scrutinize how well the social network protects user data.
articles.abstract: Talks include creating a new committee and an external assessor that would scrutinize how well the social network protects user data.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Federal Trade Commission is negotiating a settlement with Facebook that would create new positions at the company focused on strengthening its privacy practices, according to two people with knowledge of the talks.

articles.headline: Boeing’s South Carolina Plant Subject to Increased Scrutiny
articles.snippet: The factory, which makes the 787 Dreamliner, faces an unusually high level of oversight, a sign of Federal Aviation Administration concerns about the plant.
articles.abstract: The factory, which makes the 787 Dreamliner, faces an unusually high level of oversight, a sign of Federal Aviation Administration concerns about the plant.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Federal Aviation Administration has been increasing its scrutiny of Boeing’s plant near Charleston, S.C., where manufacturing errors have at times threatened to undermine safety.

articles.headline: Where the Good Jobs Are
articles.snippet: For people without a college degree, finding work that offers decent pay can be a challenge. The solution may require a change in scenery.
articles.abstract: For people without a college degree, finding work that offers decent pay can be a challenge. The solution may require a change in scenery.
articles.lead_paragraph: You dropped out of college, or decided straight out of high school that college was not your thing. Here’s some advice if you are looking for a job: Stay out of Washington. Don’t go to New York. Forget about San Francisco. If you want to make anything near a decent wage, head for Toledo, Des Moines or Birmingham.

articles.headline: Secret Venezuela Files Warn About Maduro Confidant
articles.snippet: Venezuela’s intelligence agency gathered evidence against one of the country’s most powerful figures, including accusations of drug trafficking and ties to Hezbollah.
articles.abstract: Venezuela’s intelligence agency gathered evidence against one of the country’s most powerful figures, including accusations of drug trafficking and ties to Hezbollah.
articles.lead_paragraph: He is one of the most powerful leaders of the Venezuelan government, a hard-liner who has put down protests, confronted rebels and been a constant presence at the side of Nicolás Maduro, the country’s authoritarian president.

articles.headline: Pelosi Accuses Barr of Law-Breaking as Democrats’ War With Him Boils Over
articles.snippet: Attorney General William P. Barr pulled out of a Thursday hearing of the House Judiciary Committee, and he has left House lawmakers who are investigating the president fuming and calculating.
articles.abstract: Attorney General William P. Barr pulled out of a Thursday hearing of the House Judiciary Committee, and he has left House lawmakers who are investigating the president fuming and calculating.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — House Democrats’ feud with Attorney General William P. Barr boiled over on Thursday, as Speaker Nancy Pelosi accused him of lying to Congress and the Judiciary Committee threatened to hold him in contempt if he did not promptly hand over a complete version of Robert S. Mueller III’s report.
